block.p: Despite five quarter-point interest rate increases by the Federal Reserve over 11 months, the economy has kept roaring along. So the Fed pulled out some heavier weaponry, raising rates by half a percentage point to make clear that it will do whatever is needed to head off inflation.

Despite five quarter-point interest rate increases by the Federal Reserve over 11 months, the economy has kept roaring along. So the Fed pulled out some heavier weaponry, raising rates by half a percentage point to make clear that it will do whatever is needed to head off inflation.

The central bank also hinted that further rate hikes are in the pipeline, disappointing investors who had hoped for a sign that the Fed was finished for the year. So far, though, there is not much inflation for the Fed to extinguish.
